segments.text: I notice the water spilling over the sink, and it’s getting worse by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, polishing a plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far to reach those cookies, and that stool looks ready to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is completely oblivious to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting more slippery, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children do this often when she’s not looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is going to be ruined if that water keeps pouring out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how peaceful the garden looks outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like the chaos inside doesn’t even exist out there.
segments.speaker: PAR
